document_data.name: Elemetar
document_data.mainbody: '''Elemetar''' was a [[wikipedia:en:Barony|barony]] and later the smallest county of [[Tethyr]], but contained Tethyr's second-largest city, [[Myratma]].
document_data.Geography: Elemetar was located in the [[Purple Marches]]. It was on the north banks of the [[River Ith]] across from [[Calimmon|County Calimmon]] in [[Ankaram]]. It was bordered by [[Vintor|County Vintor]] and the [[Purple Hills]] region in the west at the [[Red River]]. [[Bardshyr|County Bardshyr]] was to the north, and [[Ithmonn]] and the [[Crown Lands]] to the east.
document_data.Government: Before the [[Tethyrian Interregnum]], Elemetar was a barony ruled over by the Raslemtar family. In [[1369 DR]] it became a county and was ruled by [[Perendra Raslemtar]], the Court Vizera.
document_data.Trade: Elemetar contained the best grain fields in southern Tethyr. It was also one of the richest counties of Tethyr, as Myratma was there, and the [[Trade Way]] passed through.
document_data.History: When the [[Tethyrian Interregnum#Ten Black Days of Eleint|Ten Black Days]] passed, Baron [[Amir Raslemtar]]<ref group=note>He is named Seldoon in the [[Forgotten Realms Campaign Set|''DM's Sourcebook of the Realms'']], but [[Lands of Intrigue (boxed set)|''Lands of Intrigue Book 1: Tethyr'']] names him Amir. This article follows the more recent source. was one of only five barons to survive. He escaped Tethyr with his family, which included the young Perendra. Years later, after the Civil War, the lands were restored to the Perendra family.
